bar downtown Dawson City

Dawson City is a national designated
Historic Site
it has restored many of its original
structures you can take a walking tour
of the heritage buildings to see the
restored architecture dating back to
1896 the facades were made to give
simple log buildings the illusion of
grandeur and importance and to allow for
advertising it's a quick and easy yet
very interesting self-guided tour around
town take a paddle boat ride on the
Yukon River or visit the National
Historic Site the keynote paddle boat
that's dry docked the SS keno is a
preserved paddle wheeler that pushed
everything from gold dust to passengers
these boats were retired in the 1950s
but you can take a tour of this beauty
that's located on the Yukon River go for
a walk all along the waterfront path the
waterfront trail runs from Dawson City
to where the Klondike and Yukon rivers
meet and it's a beautiful scenic walk
there are many trails around town so be
sure to get out and explore
a trip to Dawson City is something
